pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.12.1: There is no equivalent of the “or” in the Pali, but it is implied by the origin story, which gives a separate offense for complaining.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.2: _Khajjaka_. According to [Sp.2.615]() (commenting on the _sekhiya_ rules) this refers to all non-staple foods: _Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ_, “Here the non-staple foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”
